alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 2:08PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Worcester and northeastern Franklin Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 207 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Montague, or near Greenfield, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. Heavy rain in excess of 1 in/hr SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield, Winchendon, Montague, Sunderland, Northfield, Bernardston, Conway, Shelburne, Erving, Gill, Royalston, Wendell and Warwick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin
